title: City Comparisons Overview
section: Total Obligated Funds by City and Fiscal Year
text:
Total Obligated Funds by City and Fiscal Year

All DOJ GrantsViolence Prevention Grants

title: City Comparisons Overview
text:
Footnotes


Obligated fund amounts are aggregated over all fiscal years FY ’19 - FY ’24 (though FY ’24 has very minimal data). Average annual fatal shootings per year take the 5-year average from American Violence, averaging from 2019-2023, then dividing by 5. American Violence also supplies the average annual population and fatal shooting per 100k rates, both across the same time period (2019-2023). Finally, Total/Violence Prevention Related Funds Per Fatal Shooting are calculated by taking the total Overall/Violence Prevention-related funding amount and dividing by the total number of fatal shootings. Since both are over a 5-year period, this averages out to total dollars per fatal shooting.↩︎

title: USA DOJ Spending Analysis
text:
This is a demo website, created by the UChicago Crime Lab, to analyze DOJ grant funding to cities from the USA spending page. This is an attempt to better understand the amount of funds being allocated to violence prevention related programs.
Please note that everything on this website is considered a first pass analysis, and should not be taken to reflect fully accurate numbers. Ongoing work is being done to analyze where there may be incorrect labeling, either over- or under-representing the true amount of funding going into these areas for the cities being considered.
Data Sources:

DOJ Grant Funding comes from USASpending.gov
Gun violence data comes from americanviolence.org
